job_tasks.phrase: Maintain ML models in production (i.e. retraining, monitoring health and ensuring service availability);
job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly describes the core responsibilities of maintaining ML models in a production environment, including retraining and monitoring, which falls under MLOps.

job_tasks.phrase: Implement continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines and streamline deployment workflows;
job_tasks.justification: This phrase explicitly mentions CI/CD pipelines and streamlining deployment workflows, which are key components of MLOps.

job_tasks.phrase: Responsible for batch, real-time and GenAI model deployments;
job_tasks.justification: This phrase details the deployment of various types of models, including GenAI, which is a core MLOps responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: Create and manage reusable deployment templates for ML models;
job_tasks.justification: Creating and managing deployment templates is a task that involves software development principles to enable efficient and repeatable deployments.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with data scientists during model deployment;
job_tasks.justification: This involves working with other teams to integrate models into the deployment process, which is a form of software integration.

job_tasks.phrase: Provide support in aligning the tech stack with architectural requirements in collaboration with Solution architects and IT4IT engineers.
job_tasks.justification: This task involves ensuring technical alignment with broader system architecture, a common software engineering responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: Translate the technical needs of the Data science team to appropriate templates that fit within our generalized Model Factory platform.
job_tasks.justification: This involves understanding the needs of the data science team and translating them into technical solutions (templates), demonstrating business understanding and strategic alignment.

job_tasks.phrase: consult the Model Factory team on best practices when it comes to MLOps and its implementation.
job_tasks.justification: Consulting on best practices implies understanding the business context and providing strategic guidance on MLOps implementation.

job_tasks.phrase: Implement security concerns related to ML systems with the Solution architect and IT teams;
job_tasks.justification: This involves understanding and implementing security requirements within the business context, in collaboration with other teams.

soft_skills.phrase: working with the Model Factory team (platform team) as well as the Data science team.
soft_skills.justification: This phrase indicates collaboration with different teams.

soft_skills.phrase: Collaborate with data scientists during model deployment;
soft_skills.justification: Explicit mention of collaboration with data scientists.

soft_skills.phrase: in collaboration with Solution architects and IT4IT engineers.
soft_skills.justification: Indicates collaboration with solution architects and IT engineers.

soft_skills.phrase: Implement security concerns related to ML systems with the Solution architect and IT teams;
soft_skills.justification: Implies collaboration with Solution Architect and IT teams for implementing security.

soft_skills.phrase: As a senior MLOps engineer, you will be working with the Model Factory team (platform team) as well as the Data science team.
soft_skills.justification: The 'senior' title implies a level of ownership and responsibility for guiding the team's MLOps practices.

soft_skills.phrase: consult the Model Factory team on best practices when it comes to MLOps and its implementation.
soft_skills.justification: Consulting on best practices suggests taking initiative and ownership of MLOps strategy and implementation.

profile.rationale: The job ad focuses heavily on MLOps responsibilities such as maintaining models in production, CI/CD pipelines, and model deployments (batch, real-time, GenAI). While GenAI is mentioned, the core tasks and emphasis are on the operationalization and lifecycle management of ML models, aligning with traditional MLOps. There are no specific tasks related to model development or fine-tuning (1.B.1) or prompt engineering/RAG (1.B.2). The role is primarily about the engineering and operational aspects of ML, making it a 'Core ML Engineer' profile, specifically in an MLOps capacity.

confidence.reasoning: The job advertisement is very clear and specific about the responsibilities, focusing on MLOps tasks. The distinction between core software engineering and AI specialization is well-defined by the tasks listed, allowing for a confident classification of the role.
